articles.author: Elizabeth Howell
articles.title: A 'meteor storm' of 1000 shooting stars per hour may light up the skies over North America this week - Space.com
articles.description: The Tau Herculids could bring up a meteor storm, but there's a good chance it won't happen at all.
articles.content:
Ready to embrace some meteoric uncertainty?
The Tau Herculids meteor shower may light up the skies over North America on May 30 and 31. Or it may not. There's a chance we might pass through the thic… [+2989 chars]
